title: The young Canadian innovators getting a boost from SoftBank’s Son - The Logic
meta_description: Four Ontario students joining Masason Foundation’s 34-member global cohort
main_content: By Jonathan Got Oct 14, 2022 SoftBank founder and CEO Masayoshi Son’s influence on Canada’s tech community is extending beyond venture capital deals . The Masason Foundation, established in 2016 by Son to foster young innovation talent, has selected four Ontario students as part of its latest 34-member global cohort. images.alt: Semi-trailer units and tanker trucks queue up beneath a gantry sign reading "Blue Water Bridge to U.S.A.," while three Canada-bound trucks come the other direction, toward the camera.
A head-and-shoulder shot of MP Ryan Williams standing and speaking in the House of Commons. He's wearing a blue jacket with a blue-and-yellow lapel ribbon, and a purple tie
A group of people, including a man wearing a Native American headdress, gather to cut a red ribbon in a ribbon-cutting ceremony.
